intro: Appendicula krauseana, commonly known as the Krause's appendicula, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that typically bloom in shades of white and purple. The plant grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in high-altitude environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and succulent, adapted to conserve water in arid conditions. Appendicula krauseana is often found in open habitats such as alpine meadows and rocky outcrops.
